file_content.text: [This comm station has been deactivated.]
Wait! Do you know what you're doing? That spike's no toy!
Those neutron emitters could kill us all if they're handled improperly. You're trying to shut them down, right?
I just need to contact General Aves for instructions.
That's exactly right.
A general, huh? He doesn't sound like much of an engineer either.
Who are you?
I worked at Coronet Shipping before the Empire moved in. Captain Granta kept me around for maintenance.
If you try and stop me, you won't like the results.
Don't get in my way.
Don't worry--I want the neutron emitters scrapped, too. Just let me handle the spike. I'm a professional.
Captain Granta is dead, General. We're ready to shut down the neutron emitters.
Cancel that. Imperial troops are boarding the rocket trams, trying to cripple us before we can move out.
If the Imperials hit us hard enough, we'll have no one left to send. We have to use the neutron emitters to wipe them out.
Hey! Imperials aren't the only ones using the rocket tram. Civilians have been smuggling themselves out with Imperial shipments for months.
You fire the neutron emitters now, you'll kill innocent people!
We can't kill innocent people just for a quick victory.
No emitters, then.
Then we'll have to defeat them the old-fashioned way. Let's hope winning the battle doesn't cost us the war.
Oh, I'm sure the Republic can do their job. Now let me do mine.
There. The spike worked perfectly. The neutron emitters are scrapped, and we're both free to leave.
The civilians knew the risks. We can't let the Imperials reach those troops.
Attack the Imperials.
Hey, boss, you've got the gun. I just hope nobody I know is on board.
The command went through. Everything alive on the rocket tram was wiped out.
I'll have my men meet the tram at the station to make sure. Get back to the Red Light Sector as soon as you can.
[This comm station cannot be accessed at this time.]
